website_summaries.verdict: A great choice if you are looking for an ice cream maker that specializes in sorbets and frozen fruit desserts.
pros: Comes with a paddle for processing fruit and another paddle for ice cream and yogurt
Owners love how tasty the frozen treats turn out
cons: Some customers wish the ice cream and sorbets came out with a thicker consistency

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: Did not think I would use this Ice Cream maker very much and would just pack it away after a day or two. Boy was I wrong!! Directions are really easy. And cleanup is a snap. After freezing the bowl overnight, I made ice cream the next day. Absolutely the BEST ice cream I have ever had. I have used it almost everyday. My neighbors love me!!! I have not used the sorbet paddles but if it is half as good as the ice cream, it will be wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize this came from a small business but I’m glad it did I got a lovely email thanking me for supporting them in this difficult time. This is sooo much better than the cheaper amazon brand one I bought that broke (literally broke into pieces) after 1 month. It’s easy to use and clean I bought a second tub to keep in the freezer so it’s ready to go any time. Helpful tip only churn for 5 or so minutes to have a Wendy’s frosty consistency more for store bought type ice cream
customer_reviews.author: Belinda brown

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this for very long, but the two recipes I have made so far have been GREAT! I made two recipes from the booklet that came with the unit: Banana, Mango, Strawberry (all in one) and Kiwi Lime! Both very yummy! Be sure to chop your fruit small (especially harder fruits like mango). The unit did not mash the mango as much as I would have liked, but next time I will make the pieces smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Patty D.

customer_reviews.title: My husband and I love ice cream
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love ice cream, but not the calories. I bought this so that we could make frozen fruit desserts with no added sugar or fat. We've tried several of the recipes that came with it, and all have been delicious. It's super simple to use, and we leave the bowl part in the freezer all the time so that it's always ready. I like it so much that I just ordered another one as a housewarming gift!!
customer_reviews.author: Jan D.

customer_reviews.title: Makes great tasting ice cream or sorbet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift after using a friend’s. Great for one or two people. Easy to make just keep the freezer bowl in your freezer and it is ready when you are to make a batch. Not good however if you are wanting to make a bunch up at one time. The freezer bowl needs a good eight hours of freezing before the next use.
customer_reviews.author: jlriner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing device!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing device!!! I have made gelato and ice cream and a hit each time. The best portion size is 3 cups so it makes 4-6 portion size desserts. I get the cone bowls and when it is fresh churned about 20 minutes I scoop the ice cream or gelato into the cone bowls and pop them into the freezer during dinner. Makes a fantastic dessert and the grand daughter loves to watch it churn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting dessert
customer_reviews.text: Wife bought it for our lake house and she has made some great desserts in it even when the weather was cold, of course it is much better on a hot Texas afternoon. I do not know much about the way to use it, but I do remember her saying that you have to freeze the inner part before you can use it, so don't think you're pulling it out of the box and getting it going.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this product.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It is easy and works fast. I am in control of what ingredients are in my ice cream. I am able to use coconut milk and low carb sweeteners and whatever flavor I want.
customer_reviews.author: Northern Light

customer_reviews.title: Make vanilla and chocolate ice cream every week
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use. Perfect for 2 people. This is holding up well. Some of the reviews stated that it only worked a few time. Ours is a champ. Using twice a week to make ice cream and still going strong
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Just o.k. at best
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this thing. It is well made and seems like a good idea. The ice cream comes out more like semi frozen whipped cream. If you let it harden in the freezer it is not much better as far as taste. The receipt was included in the machine. We also tried a frozen fruit receipt and it was just ok.
customer_reviews.author: GV

customer_reviews.title: Does not work like the description
customer_reviews.text: This product did not perform the way the description stated. I just ruined a lot of fruit and dairy following the directions and I never ended up with the product that was promised
customer_reviews.author: Nurse65

customer_reviews.title: Not bad. My only complaint is you have to freeze ...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad . My only complaint is you have to freeze the bowl 24 hrs in advance so no making on a whim
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not what I would call "user friendly"
customer_reviews.text: Item seems to be made well but is not easy to use, even when following directions. Sometimes things just don't work right.
customer_reviews.author: Debra W.

customer_reviews.title: Makes ice cream very well; not sure about healthy fruit desserts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping to make fruit desserts and fell into the ice cream recipes instead. It works as advertised and I am pleased with it. However, I was not able to discover any attractive healthy fruit dessert recipes so it has fallen into disuse.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I love making my keto ice cream with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Lumley

customer_reviews.title: True convenience.
customer_reviews.text: The machine works great and I'm happy I bought it. It would be better if the blades were easier to clean. It's a bit of work to get the ice cream or ice out of the blades.
customer_reviews.author: cstrober

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing- key word, simple!
customer_reviews.text: Soooo easy to make ice cream. Should be ILLEGAL!! Lol Highly recommend this ice cream maker!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica P.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing desserts!
customer_reviews.text: This dessert maker gives our family the ability to still enjoy sweet treats without all the sugar and additives found in most frozen desserts. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: SonFerg

customer_reviews.title: New product
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what it says. It produces a delicious sorbet made from fresh fruit in minutes. I've done mango sorbet and added vanilla, cinnamon a day chocolate chips. I also tried fresh peach sorbet and watermelon. Yummy. It's extremely user friendly and a very easy clean up
customer_reviews.author: Donna A. Friedlander

customer_reviews.title: 36 hours to make a quart of nasty!
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE PRODUCT! Too frustrated to say much more. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. GO BUY BREYERS!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my wife loves it and i like the ice cream feature
customer_reviews.author: alvin sitterding

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it, I love to create different flavors that are mouth watering
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Deserts without  Additives.
customer_reviews.text: Make really delicious ic cream. Made a mango srawberry fruit scoop too. I really like this thing. Just one tip; put fresh made ice cream in a container and then in the freezer overnight unless you like your ice cream with the consistentcy of a moose. Can't wait to make some other recipes too. Cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.author: G9Traveler

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I is everything we hoped it would be; easy to use, works great and easy to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Sam conver

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy my ice cream maker
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy my ice cream maker.....just have to remember to plan ahead so that the container is frozen before using
customer_reviews.author: M Portillo

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as gift for my other half best gift ever just ordered and we received an additional ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as gift for my other half best gift ever just ordered and we received an additional bowl !! So easy to use he makes his own ice cream every other night well worth giving it a go!
customer_reviews.author: shelly

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this based on reviews of Cuisinart ice cream makers. The biggest pro is that is fast. The cons are it is difficult to get the ice cream off the beater and out of the canister. A lot of ice cream ends up down the drain. A layer freezes inside the canister that is difficult to scrape out. I'm going to try a half batch as my standard recipe oozes out the top and never really fully freezes. I haven't tried fresh fruit yet.
customer_reviews.author: HollyColorado

customer_reviews.title: Really wish it had worked.
customer_reviews.text: I have had many Cuisinart products which were excellent. I bought this to save some steps in making a sorbet. This one did not work as described so I lost the ingredients for the strawberry sorbet and had a mess to clean up. The strawberries were impossible to load with the machine running and getting the cover to stay on was a joke. I sent it back as defective because I cannot imagine that this manufacturer of other quality products would knowingly let this out of the plant like this. Now I am back to a blender and my old Cuisinart ice cream machine to make sorbets. Thank goodness for Amazon's return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Retired and Loving It

customer_reviews.title: Good macine but only makes a small amount.
customer_reviews.text: The unit does a good job of making ice cream but it only makes a small amount. I tried making strawberry ice cream. The ice cream comes out very smooth. However, you are instructed to put the strawberries in first and grind them up before adding the ice cream ingredients. A lot of the strawberries freezes to the side of the mixing bowl. It works great for making chocolate chip ice cream if you use the small chocolate chips.
customer_reviews.author: E. S.

customer_reviews.title: powerful motor and a good price. don't buy anything less
customer_reviews.text: powerful motor and a good price. don't buy anything less, this is the most cost effective ice cream maker on the market. the top motor ones are toys compared to this. as for frozen fruit, well, not my thing.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Makes high-end tasting ice cream and sorbet.
customer_reviews.text: My husband is mad for this thing and uses it frequently. No issues, works great for us. We just store the tub in the freezer so it's always ready to go. We haven't bought any frozen desserts since we bought it. It also comes with some terrific recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Leanne Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: YUM
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this thing. I have made 4 different ice creams, and it works great. So much better than store bought, and I can control the sugar. Cleans up easily, and is quiet. If you use a small silicone spatula, and take the paddle apart, it is fairly easy to scrape the ice cream out.
customer_reviews.author: smores2

customer_reviews.title: ... from our garden and it turned out really really good. Next we want to try chocolate chip
customer_reviews.text: We've already made some strawberry ice cream using strawberries from our garden and it turned out really really good. Next we want to try chocolate chip. I always bought safeway Lucerne ice cream and this is just as good if not better. We really love this machine. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little counter top ice cream maker
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little counter top ice cream maker. The singular down side is that the inner bucket has to stay in the freezer full time or you have to put it in the freezer several hours before you want to make ice cream.
customer_reviews.author: OB11

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I made ice cream for Mother's Day and it was a good. Everyone liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: I like this better than Yonannas
customer_reviews.text: Made banana/cocoa powder mix which was so delicious! I like this better than Yonannas, it makes a nice uniform creamy frozen treat, and cleanup is no harder
customer_reviews.author: louiseb

customer_reviews.title: very good. next will try vanilla ice
customer_reviews.text: made all fruit sorbet. very good. next will try vanilla ice cream
customer_reviews.author: P. English

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Makes good product. Easy to use. Just the right size for 4 medium servings.
customer_reviews.author: tatter cat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item
customer_reviews.text: The machine is easy to use and produces deliciously. We live Italian granita and can produce it with this. Also adding milk or cream allows us to creat very smooth gelato. An excellent purchase
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: A fun way to use my fruit........and have dessert
customer_reviews.text: I ran across an ad for this in a magazine..and did some research on it. I am amazed at this product. I have used it to make three different frozen desserts and we have really enjoyed it. I would purchase it again...
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Having so much fun making my own ice cream! Works great with ice cream. I'm still working on fruit sorbet. Fruit seems to have big chunks.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frozen Fruit Sorbet
customer_reviews.text: Makes the best fresh fruit sorbet! So easy and so refreshing!
customer_reviews.author: gma sharon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good value and fun to use and to eat the results!
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Cleanup is easy. Makes the best icecream
customer_reviews.author: 😁

customer_reviews.title: My biggest complaint is that most of the product sticks to the blades which makes removing quite difficult and leads to a lot of
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok machine . My biggest complaint is that most of the product sticks to the blades which makes removing quite difficult and leads to a lot of waste .
customer_reviews.author: Tadmor Tadri

customer_reviews.title: Nice product. The only thing I did not like ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. The only thing I did not like was the description of the blades - there are two - for making several frozen desserts. In the catalog they are indicated as (c) and (d). By making these recipes they could have referred to c or d blades, thereby making it clearer which blade to use as the description often leaves one to wonder which of the two is to be made. It would also have been nicer if there were two separate units for the blades instead of having to insert one or the other into the housing. Other than that, it was fun making these desserts.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Keylard

customer_reviews.title: it's ok
customer_reviews.text: It is kind of confusing to put together. I put just strawberries in and expected it to have more of a sorbet consistency...it didn't come out that way.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy K

customer_reviews.title: didn't take up too much freezer space and was short enough to easily fit on the top drawer of the freezer
customer_reviews.text: I thought that the bowl might not fit in my bottom freezer drawer, but it was very compact, didn't take up too much freezer space and was short enough to easily fit on the top drawer of the freezer. In fact it is small enough to just leave it in there in the event you have a craving for ice cream. Recipes are easy, but the prep time is by far the longest part of the process.
customer_reviews.author: Fenderheight

product_meta.title: Cuisinart ICE-31 Fruit Scoop Frozen Dessert and Ice Cream Maker, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Imagine making scrumptious, healthy frozen desserts that are 100% fresh fruit. The Cuisinart Fruit Scoop Frozen Dessert Maker is designed with a unique paddle that crushes and freezes chunks of fresh, ripe fruit to create a variety of delicious frozen fruit treats - chunky textured to creamy smooth. A second paddle turns the unit into a genuine Cuisinart Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt maker. The large spout on top lets users add fruit, ice cream and yogurt mixtures, or a combination of fruit and mixtures and fl avorings to provide an unending variety of frozen dessert and drink options. Churns and freezes a quart and a half in 18 to 25 minutes. Healthy, nondairy, fresh and fruity to totally rich, creamy and decadent, this dessert maker does it all.
feature_bullets: Turns chunks of fresh, ripe fruit into healthy and delicious frozen desserts
Makes 100% frozen fruit treats, ice cream and frozen yogurt
Fully automatic - just turn machine on and add ingredients and mix-ins through spout on top
Large 11/2-quart capacity; ready in 18 to 25 minutes
Two paddles - one to mash and process fruit, one for ice cream and frozen yogurt

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars88 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
